## writing

author bio
Sharon Lin is a Chinese-American writer living in New York City. Her work is published in The Offing, Penumbra, The Wave, and has been recognized by the Alliance for Young Artists & Writers and Penguin Random House. She was previously a First Reader for Polyphony Lit and enjoys waking up early and petting Yorkshire Terriers.

poetry
“black sugar and honey”, The Wave
“bedtime rituals”, ROOTED Zine
“when my grandmother sings”, The Offing

prose
“Swiftly”, Penumbra

nonfiction
“How to Build the Strongest Arches”, Hackaday
“How A Secret Gaming Scene Emerged In Communist East Germany”, Hackaday
“FPGAs, SoCs, Microcontrollers: A Quick Rundown”, Hacker Noon
